prompt.p: The rate of production of red cells is governed by erythropoietin.
From which organ is erythropoietin secreted?

modalFeedback.p: Option A (Kidney) is Correct. Erythropoietin is a glycosylated protein of 165 amino acids produced by the kidney (90%), and to a lesser extent by the liver.

Option B (Bone marrow) is Incorrect. Erythropoietin is produced by the kidney.
Option C (Spleen) is Incorrect. Erythropoietin is produced by the kidney.
Option D (Heart) is Incorrect. Erythropoietin is produced by the kidney.
Option E (Lungs) is Incorrect. Erythropoietin is produced by the kidney.
